result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ.
Defendant did not speak to SPD. He was going to speak to them today. 
Court denies appointment of Counsel.

Adj: 9:54 a.m.

Indigency hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 18, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 28, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Jury status hearing on January 20, 2023 at 09:40 am.
Jury Trial on February 1, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

3:11 p.m.
Clerk Micki. 

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde.  Defendant appears in custody from the MCJ via Zoom video, with Attorney Peter Vu.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession or use of weapons. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
